intro: Aneilema mortehanii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, blue, and white, bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. Aneilema mortehanii prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
